Unfortunately it is not easy to know why you are seeing this strange beha=
vior, but I agree that it looks like something is wrong, assuming these are=
 champion fitnesses.  NEAT normally would not show decreasing champion fitn=
ess if elitism is in place, but I don't know exactly how the MATLAB version=
 is implemented, so there could be something I don't know.  But it seems li=
ke you might have to do some digging to see what is happening to champions =
that have low error at the start - are they being removed with having offps=
ring for some strange reason?  You probably need to do a little debugging t=
o find out.

Also, note that most versions of NEAT do not work with negativ=
e fitness, so if you are literally using -mse, maybe that's somehow related=
 to the problem.  That is, if you literally use negative numbers for fitnes=
s, for most implementations the algorithm's behavior is unpredictable but a=
lmost certainly bad.   The reason is that fitness is used in speciation equ=
ations, and those equations assume positive numbers or else they don't come=
 out right.

Best,

ken
